author: DarwinJS
body:
During an automated build, this command:
Install-Module Pester -MinimumVersion '4.0.5' -MaximumVersion '4.0.5' -Force -SkipPublisherCheck

Get's this error:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11597190/46230542-e7d5d100-c336-11e8-99cf-8b3e03f86e4e.png)

By the time I get to the machine for diagnosis, get-packagerepository only shows the regular entry for "PSGallery"

My code never creates a PSGallery2.

Is there some new background behavior with the new PowerShellGallery.com ?

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body: @DarwinJS do you have any more information on this at all?

comments.author: DarwinJS
comments.body: No.  I just know this code is unchanged and I can't find that PSGallery2 exists when I get on the machine.

comments.author: DarwinJS
comments.body: I know I can fix it with '-Repository PSGallery' - but it would be a pain to need to do that on every install-module command.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @DarwinJS can you open an issue in https://github.com/powershell/powershellget repo?

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body:
Where is this on? As the version shown of PowerShellGet being 1.0.0.1 was the version that had many changes being shipped within different Insider builds of Windows 10.

Also this should really be filed on the PowerShellGet repository & not this one as it's an issue with PowerShellGet at first glance

Could you raise this over there and include the following further information

-  Windows OS version

title: Breaking Change: Two PSGallery Entries
